definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
the right to a fair trial

sentences.english: It seems unfair. Except at the margins, there isn't much we can do about physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 似乎老天不太公平，我们不太能改变自己的长相。

sentences.english: Everyone feels resentment at being treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会为受到不公平的待遇而感到愤慨。

sentences.english: We are committed to carrying out settlement audit for construction engineering and calculating the construction cost impartially and fairly.
sentences.chinese: 对建设工程进行决算审计，公正公平地确定工程造价。

sentences.english: Our teacher is known for her fairness in grading pupils.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师以给学生评分公平著称。

sentences.english: Globalization will not self-regulate in ways that ensure fair distribution of benefits.
sentences.chinese: 全球化不会自我调节，确保公平分配利益。

sentences.english: Again, I'm not opposed to long-term deficit reduction, so long as it's equitable.
sentences.chinese: 同样，我不反对长期削减赤字，只要它的公平。

sentences.english: Time is the most fair and reasonable-it never gives more to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 时间是最公平合理的，它从不多给谁一分钟。

sentences.english: This is unfair, and definitely hinders the healthy development of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这是很不公平的，而且严重阻碍了经济的健康发展。

sentences.english: The indicting condition of civil lawsuit is exact in our country.
sentences.chinese: 我国民事诉讼的起诉条件比较严格，对当事人不公平。

sentences.english: Does the organization allow for equitable representation by clubs in the district?
sentences.chinese: 这个组织是否有让地区内的扶轮社有公平表现的机会？

sentences.english: He said the agnostics were also demanding a "more even-handed" bibliography.
sentences.chinese: 他说不可知论者也要求一个“更加公平的”书目。

sentences.english: A fair game depends on an unbiased referee.
sentences.chinese: 一场公平的赛事取决于一位大公无私的球证。

sentences.english: Plea-bargaining went on and I think that the outcome was fair.
sentences.chinese: 辩诉交易就这样进行了，我想结果是公平的。

sentences.english: Judges should be impartial, sometimes even desensitised, to give a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 法官必须公平地，甚至撇开个人恶好去判决。

sentences.english: Fu, not overcharging, poor does not fill the lack of a policy fairness.
sentences.chinese: 不能富时多收了，穷时并不补，缺少了政策的公平性。

sentences.english: Fairtrade gives the buyers the satisfaction of helping those who need it most.
sentences.chinese: 而公平贸易能让购买者获得帮助最需要的人的满足感。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
to take responsibility/to bear responsibility/to be responsible
